content:
• Friday, January 13, 2017

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: URA +18.2%. EWY +4.3%. KOL +4.2%. UNG +4.1%. REMX +3.9%.
    • Top losers: VXX -3.1%. OIL -2.6%. USO -2.3%. VDE -2.2%. BNO -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • PCAR

    Paccar, Colfax upgraded at RBC

    • Paccar (PCAR +1.8%) pushes higher after shares are upgraded to Outperform at both RBC Capital and BMO Capital.
    • RBC says it is more constructive on PCAR's end markets and earnings outlook, and sees the NAFTA Class 8 market as troughing in 2017 with Europe more resilient than feared; meanwhile, PCAR remains a best in class operator with a strong balance sheet and cash generation and an opportunity to improve margins as it increases internal engine penetration and parts revenues rise.
    • RBC also upgrades Colfax (CFX +3.9%) to Outperform, seeing CFX's markets at or near a bottom, which along with restructuring actions should support better growth ahead for a company with potentially significant untapped earnings power and ability to generate cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • BETR

    Margin seen improving at Amplify Snacks Brands

    • Amplify Snack Brands (BETR +7.6%) jumps after a positive note from D.A. Davidson points to the potential for margins to rise at the food company.
    • The investment firm bases its forecast on a large Amplify customer switching to a higher-margin product.
    • On Wall Street, three firms have Buy ratings on BETR (including Davidson) and four are in with Holds.
    • Sources: Bloomberg and Marketbeat.com
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • SNOW

    IntraWest Resorts +10% on sale talk

    • Intrawest Resorts Holdings (SNOW +9.8%) spikes after Reuters report a sale could be in the works.
    • Sources indicate the company is already working with investment banks.
    • Shares of SNOW have more than doubled over the last year.
    • Earlier today, Vail Resorts updated on its season-to-date results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SNAK

    Confidence in Inveture Foods buyout fades

    • The bottom continues to fall out for Inventure Foods (SNAK -13.7%). Shares are now down 35% in less than a week and hit a low of $6.16 earlier.
    • The decline in share price is being attributed by D.A. Davidson to reduced confidence that a buyer will step out to take over the company.
    • Last summer, Inventure Foods initiated a strategic review.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • YRCW

    Trucking stocks rev higher

    • Trucking stocks are bouncing back strong after hitting a rough patch over the last week.
    • "I think today’s strength is simply a reversal of the recent stock underperformance of the truckers since peaking in early December, as well as a recognition that 4Q-end trends in December were solid, particularly in truckload," Baird analyst Benjamin Hartford tells Bloomberg.
    • Thge list of notable gainers includes YRC Worldwide (YRCW +6.5%), Patriot Transportation (PATI +5.5%), Covenant Transportation Group (CVTI +5.1%), USA Truck (USAK +4.8%), Marten Transport (MRTN +3.7%), ArcBest Corporation (ARCB +4%), Celadon Group (CGI +3.8%), Echo Global Logistics (ECHO +3.4%), Heartland Express (HTLD +2.2%) and Landstar System (LSTR +1.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 13 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: IOTS +16%. TNAV +15%. ENPH +13%. RUBI +12%. AIRG +10%.
    • Losers: TCCO -7%. AAOI -6%. LEDS -6%. HMNY -6%. INFY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    Herbalife up nearly 4% after FTC chief sets exit

    • A notable opponent of MLMs, FTC Chairwoman Edith Ramirez announces her resignation, effective Feb. 10. Her exit will leave just two commissioners - one a D, and one a R - meaning the new administration will have three slots to fill.
    • Ramirez's replacement will also surely be less hostile to mergers (she helped stop the Staples/Office Depot and Sysco/ U.S. Foods deals).
    • Herbalife (HLF +3.8%), NuSkin (NUS +2.3%), Avon (AVP +1.1%), Primerica (PRI +3%) are among the names which may find easier sledding.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 268 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:45 pm

    • Gainers: SN +29%. SPP +13%. NAK +12%. CENX +10%. BCEI +9%.
    • Losers: URRE -19%. GLF -14%. TDW -8%. ZEUS -7%. PACD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • BABA

    Alibaba has no plans to buy Groupon - StreetInsider

    • Alibaba's (NYSE:BABA) 5.6% stake in Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) is about as high as it wants to go, according to a report at StreetInsider, which cites a person familiar with matter.
    • Despite this story, Groupon has given back none of yesterday's rumor-related gains, and remains higher by 1.1% on today's session.
    • Previously: Groupon +2.3% amid rumor of Alibaba's interest (Jan. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 24 Comments
  • CMG

    No love for Chipotle from Raymond James

    • Raymond James is still bearish on Chipotle (CMG +0.2%) following the company's sales update and ICR appearance.
    • "We continue to see a sharply negative risk/reward skew as consensus estimates seem overly aggressive and believe the stock’s historical valuation (35x+) will be difficult to recover (growth algorithm from normalized EPS base likely in upper teens). Our bull/bear analysis suggests a negative risk/reward from current levels (downside $225-300; upside $412, in-line with current stock price)," writes the analyst team.
    • Shares of CMG are rated by Raymond James at Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer touched by Fiat's EPA troubles

    • Fiat Chrysler has had a rough couple of sessions as the EPA alleges the company used engine management software to violate the Clean Air Act.
    • Santander Consumer (SC -2.6%), of course, originates loans and leases for a number of Chrysler models under the Chrysler Capital brand, notes Sandler O'Neill's Chris Donat.
    • The number of vehicles is relatively small, he says, but still accounts for 2.6% of Santander's total. He sees limited origination impact unless the scandal worsens.
    • Previously: Fiat Chrysler -4% on report of DoJ criminal probe (Jan. 13)
    • Previously: Fiat Chrysler shares continue free fall (Jan. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • TSRO

    Tesaro and Clovis +7% - 'Year of the PARPs' says Morgan Stanley

    • Initiated alongside Clovis Oncology (reported here) with an Overweight rating at Morgan Stanley is Tesaro (NASDAQ:TSRO).
    • Wedbush also comes to Tesaro's defense following yesterday's CRL from the FDA, hiking its price target to $166 and suggesting the name as an attractive takeout target.
    • Both Clovis and Tesaro are higher by 7% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • TKTDQ

    Takata charged with criminal count in U.S.

    • Takata (TKTDY) was formally charged today in the U.S. with a felony count of wire fraud related to the defective air bag issue.
    • The Japanese auto parts supplier is expected to plead guilty as part of a structured deal.
    • Shares of Takata spiked 16% in Tokyo today on news of a pending deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPHC

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: [[]] +%. OPHC +8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CZR

    Caesars comes to terms with U.S. bankruptcy trustee

    • Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) can now see the door for a post-bankrupcty existence after a deal between the company's operating unit was the U.S. government bankruptcy watchdog was worked out.
    • The agreement is expected to be filed with the court shortly and signed by the presiding judge.
    • Shares of Caesars are up 6.36% to $9.20 vs. a 52-week trading range of $5.39 to $10.84. Caesars Acquisition Company (NASDAQ:CACQ) is up 4.06%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GLBS +136%. DXCM +31%. SN +29%. TBIO +28%. PME +22%. DCIX +20%. ENPH +21%. IOTS +19%. PHMD +22%. TNAV +19%.
    • Losers: URRE -14%. SKLN -15%. SNAK -14%. PYDS -12%. XGTI -11%. TPIV -11%. PERF -11%. OPGN -10%. RYI -9%. THST -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla is Baird's 'Best Pick for 2017'

    • While the SolarCity acquisition made for a headwind last year, shareholder approval of the deal has removed that overhang, says Baird's Ben Kallo, thus allowing investors to focus on positive catalysts - namely the Gigafactory and Model 3 production ramps.
    • Kallo and team name Tesla (TSLA +2.3%) their "Best Pick for 2017."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 214 Comments
  • FCAU

    Fiat Chrysler -4% on report of DoJ criminal probe

    • Fiat Chrysler (FCAU -4%) tumbles following a Bloomberg report that it is under criminal investigation by the U.S. Justice Department over its alleged failure to disclose software that violated emissions standards.
    • CEO Sergio Marchionne said yesterday in a conference call with reporters that he expected the probe.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 12 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle acquires satellite communication payload; shares +7%

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (NASDAQ:ENT) has acquired Ku-band payload on an SES communication satellite in a move to boost capacity for its customers in North America, the Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean.
    • Shares +6.98% to $6.74.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • DX

    Dynex Capital leads mortgage REITs lower after downgrade

    • Formerly a bull on Dynex Capital (DX -1.9%), JMP's Steven Delaney now rates the stock just a Market Perform.
    • No details are available, but Dynex is up 12.3% Y/Y, and last night's close of $6.88 was an 11% discount to Sept. 30 book value. That discount is presumably narrower to today's book value, given the sharp rise in rates to end the year.
    • REM -0.3%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • RUBI

    Rubicon Project +11%; exploration of strategic options, possible sale reported

    • Rubicon Project is sourced as working with Morgan Stanley on the process. No comment has been issued by the company on the matter.
    • Shares (NYSE:RUBI) to $8.43.
    • Full report [Wall Street Journal]
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 12 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: PME +27%. WATT +7%. THRM +6%. BREW +6%.
    • Losers: SNAK -13%. THST -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNR

    Pentair, Roper upgraded at J.P. Morgan on Trump effect; GE a "top avoid"

    • Pentair (PNR +2.1%) and Roper Technologies (ROP +0.9%) are upgraded to Overweight from Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which believes the stocks have not received as much as credit as other electrical equipment and multi-industry stocks for anticipated Trump-related benefits.
    • On PNR, given low expectations set in October and less stock appreciation due to an already low tax rate, the firm sees potential for relative upside to organic growth in a better economy and less downside in a sluggish/steady-state economy, all at an attractive discount.
    • JPM downgrades TriMas (TRS +0.7%) to Neutral from Overweight, citing valuation following the stock's outperformance over the last three months; the firm also reiterates Honeywell (HON +0.5%), Ingersoll-Rand (IR +1%) and Danaher (DHR +0.3%) at Overweight, and Rockwell Automation (ROK +0.8%) at Underweight while naming General Electric (GE -0.2%) a "top avoid," expecting core operating performance to track below plan driven by weak fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 21 Comments
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo -5.5% amid reveal of Switch pricing, launch details

    • While early reviews (Engadget, The Verge) are coming in positive for the overall Nintendo Switch (NTDOY, NTDOF) system experience, concerns over a higher-than-expected $299.99 pricing level and initial game content selection are currently being weighed following announcement of a March 3 launch.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 46 Comments
  • GNRT

    Gener8 Maritime announces delivery of the Gener8 Hector; Shares up 4.19%

    • Gener8 Maritime (NYSE:GNRT) announced that it took delivery of the ECO VLCC the Gener8 Hector on Jan. 6, 2017 from Hanjin Heavy Industries and Construction Philippines.
    • The Gener8 Hector represents the 19th of 21 ECO VLCCs expected to be delivered into Gener8 Maritime's fleet. Upon delivery, the Gener8 Hector entered Navig8 Group's VL8 Pool.
    • Shares +4.19% to $4.48.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: DXCM +23%. SGMO +9%. XBIT +9%. TTNP +9%. AKAO +9%.
    • Losers: SKLN -18%. MRNS -11%. OPGN -11%. OPXA -8%. NSPR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    9% bruising for GameStop after listless holiday sales

    • Investors are punishing GameStop (GME -9.1%) after the retailer reported a sharp drop in holiday sales.
    • On Wall Street, Macquarie lowers its price target on GME to $23, while investors are still waiting to hear from the 11 investment firms with Buy ratings on GameStop.
    • After today's drop, GameStop now yields 6.60% to new buyers, although Seeking Alpha contributors have a lot to say on if the income play will pay off.
    • Previously: GameStop reports 19% drop in holiday comparable sales (Jan. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • CIEN

    UBS starts Buy coverage on Ciena

    • Analyst Tejas Venkatesh cites macro tailwinds, structural alterations within optical market, improved execution, revenue diversification and margins, rate of free cash flow generation (best in company history while public) and 100G metro product cycle among catalysts.
    • Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) target $29 (current price $24.61, +2.03%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • GWPH

    Goldman likes GW Pharma, sees 56% upside

    • Goldman Sachs initiates coverage on GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH +2.4%) with a Buy rating and $189 (56% upside) price target. Four other shops recently updated their coverage. All agree with Goldman with fair value targets ranging from $135 (12% upside) to $208 (72% upside).
    • The company's lead product candidate is Epidiolex (cannabidiol) for the treatment of epilepsy. It expects to file its U.S. marketing application in the coming months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 15 Comments
  • SKIS

    Janney: No peak yet for Peak Resorts

    • Janney reiterates a Buy rating on Peak Resorts (SKIS +1.8%).
    • The investment firm sets a fair value estimate of $7 on the resort operator vs. $5.50 prior.
    • Earlier today, Vail Resorts reported a slow start to the 2016-2017 ski season.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRUB

    Morgan Stanley upgrades GrubHub to Overweight; +3.85%

    • From Equal Weight, analyst Brian Nowak notes GrubHub (NYSE:GRUB) had been able to grow in 2016 despite market presence of Postmates, DoorDash, Uber, Amazon and others.
    • Anticipates continuing restaurant and diner growth, and together with platform optimization, "faster-than-expected" revenue and EPS results for GrubHub.
    • Raises share target from $36 to $44 (current price $38.81).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy +23% as Eagle Ford deal looks like bargain

    • Sanchez Energy (SN +22.8%) skyrockets higher to 52-week highs in early trading following its $2.3B deal, in a 50/50 partnership with Blackstone (BX +0.1%), for Anadarko Petroleum's (APC +0.6%) Eagle Ford Shale assets in south Texas.
    • The deal looks favorable for SN given an implied purchase price of less than $35K per boe/day, low-cost optionality on “considerbale upside potential," enahnced scale, and third-party “validation from a savvy energy investor,” according to FBR analyst Chad Mabry, who rates SN at Outperform.
    • The sale price “seems low” relative previous news stories stating that $3B-$3.5B was possible, but those estimates likely included APC selling midstream assets which may be worth ~$1B, says Drexel Hamilton's Robert Christensen, who rates APC a Buy.
    • SN says the deal more than doubles its drilling inventory and adds 33.5K boe/day to production; it says it will fully fund its 50% of the acquisition with cash on hand and commercial bank and preferred equity commitments at a newly formed non-recourse subsidiary.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 11 Comments
  • DAL

    Delta higher after guidance sized up

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL +1%) is higher after analysts issue positive analysis on the company's path for 2017.
    • Cowen's Helane Becker says the improvement in business demand should help lift yields. Her price target goes to $60 from $57.
    • Argus points to Delta's fleet upgrade and network expansion as earnings drivers. The firm has shares rated at Buy with a $56 PT.
    • Delta's commitment to take margins higher is being well-received across the Street and by investors looking for restraint on capacity.
    • "We will remain conservative and keep our capacity growth in check until we see a further firming of these revenue trends in the near-term and longer-term, a return to our 17-19 percent operating margin target," noted Delta CEO Ed Bastian yesterday.
    • Previously: Delta tops revenue estimates, sets conservative capacity guidance (Jan. 12)
    • Previously: Delta Air Lines EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Jan. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 4 Comments
  • BAC

    Investors give 'thumbs up' to bank earnings; KBE +2.3%

    • There was a bit of caution among bank investors in the past couple of days, but they're back to buying low and selling high this morning as the initial results from Q4 begin to pour in. Among those reporting today: Bank of America (BAC +1.8%), JPMorgan (JPM +1.9%), Wells Fargo (WFC +2.8%), PNC Financial (PNC +2.4%), First Horizon (FHN -0.3%).
    • KBE +2.3%, KRE +2.5%; the S&P 500 is ahead 0.3%.
    • An early take from KBW's Bose George: Mortgage banking trends are weakening in line with expectations - with stronger volumes being offset by lower gain-on-sale margins. Higher rates are still filtering through though, and industry sources and recent data suggest volumes falling 10-15% this quarter.
    • Piper's Kevin Barker calls Wells Fargo's operating numbers "decent," but notes rising auto loan net charge-offs - 1.05% in Q4  vs. 0.87% in Q3, and 0.59% a year earlier.
    • Bloomberg's Alison Williams takes note of the positive signal of boosted buybacks at Bank of America, and calls cost cuts "key." It's hard to get too excited about any particular metric given the bank's near-50% run higher in the past few months.
    • Other players: Goldman (GS +1.1%), Morgan Stanley (MS +2%), Citigroup (C +1.6%), U.S. Bancorp (USB +1.3%), Regions Financial (RF +3.2%), New York Community (NYCB +1.3%), Huntington Bancshares (HBAN +2.2%), KeyCorp (KEY +2.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 10 Comments
  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma up 25%; OPKO takes 5% stake

    • In a 13G filed after the close yesterday, RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +24.6%) discloses a 446,360-share (5.1%) stake by OPKO Health (OPK +0.5%).
    • RXi develops RNAi therapeutics in dermatology and ophthalmology. Its lead product candidate in the former is RXI-109, in Phase 2 development for dermal scarring. Its lead candidate in the latter is also RXI-109, in Phase 1 development for retinal scarring.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 43 Comments
  • RBA

    Ritchie Bros down 2.6% as BAML calls top in auction cycle

    • via Notable Calls:
    • The tide is starting to turn, says BAML, downgrading Ritchie Bros (NYSE:RBA) to Underperform. The $29.50 price target suggests about 13% downside from last night's close.
    • The team believes auction volumes could stall, and notes underwhelming auctions in energy driven regions in Q4.
    • Shares -2.55% to $33.12.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • IMMR

    Immersion enters multi-year deal with Nintendo; +5.5%

    • Immersion (NASDAQ:IMMR) TouchSense technology to integrate with Nintendo Switch gaming system and allow for developers to use Immersion software for game design.
    • Immersion CEO Vic Vegas: "We are thrilled about the opportunity to work with Nintendo to bring Immersion’s TouchSense technology to their customers. Nintendo sets the bar with their gaming systems, and adding advanced touch effects will give them an additional edge in delivering an incredible gaming experience to their customers." [press release]
    • Earlier this week (January 11, 2017): Immersion -7.42%; Apple granted inter parties review of unpatentability of certain Immersion claims [updated]
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • TIF

    Tiffany runs higher again

    • Tiffany (TIF +1.4%) is higher again after an upgrade from Wells Fargo to Market Perform.
    • The early push higher follows a strong jump yesterday after a strong report from Richemont raised hopes for the luxury sector.
    • Shares of Tiffany peaked at $85.44 last month before concerns over F/X and the media frenzy at Trump Tower sent some jittery investors to the sidelines.
    • Previously: Richemont and peers rally after strong report (Jan. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: TBIO +21%. APVO +20%. DXCM +18%. TTNP +12%. SN +12%. NEPT +9%. P +8%. ETRM +7%. OPXA +5%. SGMO +5%.
    • Losers: URRE -26%. SKLN -18%. MRNS -9%. GME -7%. MYOS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMCSA

    Comcast +0.8% after Deutsche upgrade

    • The market isn't yet fully pricing in tax reform, says analyst Brian Kraft, boosting Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) to Buy from Neutral and setting a price target of $88 (nearly 24% upside).
    • He's assuming a 25% effective tax rate beginning in 2018, as well as hopes for eased regulation.
    • Shares +0.8% premarket to $72.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Goldman still bullish on BofA after Q4 results

    • The Q4 earnings beat was driven mostly by a lower tax rate and lower expenses, says Goldman Sachs in a quick first-take on Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) results. Core earnings of $0.37 compared to the Goldman's team estimate of $0.38.
    • Goldman's bullish view on BofA remains largely intact thanks to leverage to higher rates and continued cost control. The stock is on the Conviction List with a $27 price target suggesting nearly another 20% of upside.
    • Downside risks include a slower rise in interest rates and slower economic growth.
    • Shares now lower by 0.85% premarket as satiated bulls use the earnings news as a reason to cash in some chips.
    • Previously: BofA edges higher after topping bottom-line estimates (Jan. 13)
    • Previously: Bank of America beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (Jan. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 12 Comments
  • MBLY

    Mobileye set with Buy rating at Jefferies

    • Firm highlights Mobileye as a top supplier within quickly expanding active vehicle safety market and projects sales growth at an estimated 44% annually through 2020 attributed to beneficial positioning.
    • Target $52. Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) pre-market $42.02, +2.89%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen's Spinraza reduced risk of death or permanent ventilation by 47% in SMA patients in late-stage study; shares up 1% premarket

    • Biogen (NASDAQ:BIIB) inches up in light premarket trading. This morning it announced that the Phase 3 ENDEAR study assessing SPINRAZA (nusinersen) in infants with spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) met its primary endpoint. The data were presented a the British Paediatric Neurology Association annual conference in Cambridge, UK, January 11-13. The positive outcome was already baked into the price since the study was ended early in August 2016 and SPINRAZA was approved in the U.S. last month.
    • In an end-of-study (EOS) analysis, patients treated with SPINRAZA experienced a 47% reduction in the risk of death or permanent ventilation (p<0.01). In addition, a greater percentage of untreated infants (68%) died or required permanent ventilation than those treated with SPINRAZA (39%).
    • Further EOS data will be presented at future medical conferences.
    • Biogen licensed nusinersen from Ionis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IONS) in 2012. Its marketing application in Europe is currently under review. Filings have been made in Japan, Canada and Australia with more to follow this year.
    • Nusinersen is an antisense drug designed to correct the splicing defect that causes SMA by increasing the production of fully functional SMN protein.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIPT

    Skyline Medical prices equity offering; shares down 13% premarket

    • Skyline Medical (SKLN) slumps 13% premarket on increased volume in response to the pricing of its public offering of 1.75M Units at $2.25. Each Unit consists of one share of common stock and 0.2 of a Series D Warrant to purchase one share of common at $2.25.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 175K shares of stock or warrants to purchase up to 35K common shares at a price of $0.01 per warrant. Closing date is January 18.
    • Yesterday's close was $2.82.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 6 Comments
  • DXCM

    CMS OKs reimbursement for DexCom's CGM system

    • The U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) has established reimbursement for DexCom's (NASDAQ:DXCM) G5 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System by classifying it as Durable Medical Equipment (DME), the first CGM device to receive this classification. Other CGM products are considered adjunctive devices (complement but do not replace blood glucose meters) and are not reimbursed.
    • In order to be classified as DME, the product must meet five criteria: it can withstand repeated use, has an expected life span of at least three years, serves a medical purpose, is generally not useful in the absence of a disease or injury and is appropriate for home use.
    • The G5 clearly meets four of the five criteria. It meets the fifth, the three-year life span, via the expected useful life of the receiver.
    • According to CMS, the reimbursement for buying the G5 system will be $236- 277 or $24 - 28 per month for renting the device (10% of the purchase price). Total rental payments cannot exceed the reimbursement for purchasing the product. The monthly reimbursement for accessories and supplies will be $248.38 for 2017.
    • CMS's action surprised analysts since the approval was not expected until next year.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket but only on 300 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 10 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix higher after Deutsche Bank sheds sell sign

    • Deutsche Bank upgrades Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) to Hold after having a Sell rating on the streamer.
    • The investment firm expects Netflix to beat its own guidance and consensus estimates with its tally of Q4 global subscribers.
    • The price target on Netflix from DB goes to $110 from $92 on its view that valuation is still frothy.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 29 Comments
  • BGI

    Birks Group higher after reporting strong holiday sales

    • Birks Group (NYSEMKT:BGI) announces that holiday comparable store sales rose 11% on a constant exchange rate basis.
    • Comparable store sales in the U.S. were up 16% during the period, while Canadian comparable store sales increased 3% (constant currency).
    • BGI +2.36% premarket to $1.30.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • GME

    GameStop reports 19% drop in holiday comparable sales

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) reports global sales for the holiday period fell 16.4% to $2.50B.
    • Comparable store sales decreased 18.7% for the two-month period, consisting of a 26.6% decline in November and 13.0% fall in December.
    • “During the holiday period, sales in the video game segment were impacted by industry weakness, promotional pricing pressure and lower in-store traffic, amidst a difficult holiday season for many retailers," notes CEO Paul Raines
    • New hardware sales were down 30.3% as a large decline in PlayStation 4 and Xbox One hardware sales factored in.
    • Sales of new video game software decreased 22.8% due to difficult comparisons to titles launched a year ago, lower average selling prices and decreased store traffic.
    • Shares of GameStop are inactive in the premarket session.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 28 Comments
  • FCAU

    Fiat Chrysler shares continue free fall

    • Building on yesterday's 10% plunge, shares of Fiat Chrysler (NYSE:FCAU) are down 3% premarket, after the EPA accused the automaker of using software to allow excess diesel emissions.
    • The notice affects over 100K cars, including trucks and SUVs, and the maximum fine that could be imposed would total $4.6B.
    • CEO Sergio Marchionne called the regulator "belligerent" and said if anyone believed the allegation then "they had been smoking something."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 AM | 22 Comments
  • TKTDQ

    Takata nears $1B settlement with DOJ

    • Takata (TKTDY) shares jumped 16% overnight after the Japanese airbag maker reached an agreement with the DOJ over its faulty airbags.
    • The settlement, which could come as soon as today, includes a $25M criminal fine, $125M in victim compensation and $850M to reimburse automakers who have suffered as a result of Takata's widespread recalls.
